Description: Glazed composition or ivory amulet pendant in the form of an Egyptian "ankh" or crux ausata with a small loop at the top with a transverse hole perforated for suspension.
Bibliographic references: Curtis 1993a / William Kennett Loftus and his excavations at Susa (C.73, pp.25-26, pls. 8 (no.9) and 18a, fig. 7)
